Summary With over 15 years of experience in the photonics industry with extensive experience building, aligning, testing and troubleshooting prototype components such as opto-mechanical, laser based test and measurement equipment, fiber optics and MEMS Based switches. 
I'm Self-motivated team player that thrives in both R&D and manufacturing environments. I'm Self-motivated team player that thrives in both R&D and manufacturing environments. Experience Sr. Laboratory Technician InvenSense, Inc. September 2013  –  April 2014  (8 months) San Jose Ca Conduct failure analysis testing on MEMS based semiconductor motion devices 
Responsible for FA testing and reporting results to the engineering Associate Manufacturing Engineer Prysm May 2012  –  February 2013  (10 months) San Jose CA Responsible for pilot line production of LPD (laser phosphate display) video display panels 
• Subassembly, assembly and system level building, integration, alignment and testing of laser light engine modules 
• Contribute to the development of tooling, fixtures and process for assembly and testing 
• Developed, wrote, preformed and documented assembly and testing procedures 
• Inspected optical parts to mechanical and optical specifications Sr. Engineering Technician Capella Photonics 2005  –  2012  (7 years) San Jose Ca Assisted in the development of 3rd generation Wavelength Selective Switches (WSS) ROADM, to manage traffic through the next-generation optical networks. A MEMS based system. 
•	Completely setup and ran a full pilot production line to qualify the manufacturability of the WSS optical switch product. 
•	Successfully transfer products and manufacturing lines to the contract manufacturer in Thailand and Japan. 
•	Responsible for qualifying next generation product design, test and measure prototype modules including MEMS based switch components.  
•	Assist with training manufacturing groups and support troubleshooting of technical issues with optical switch and process flow. 
•	Conduct a Failure analyses on RMA’s (Return Material Authorization) units from the field. 
•	Worked with part vendors to insure product meet company specifications and process flow Optics Specialist Contractor Rockwell Collins 2004  –  2005  (1 year) San Jose Ca Manufacturing support on visual displays instrument panels for military use.  
Responsible for all Quarter wave plate assemblies as well process improvement. Engineering Technician Contractor Intel Corporation 2003  –  2004  (1 year) Fremont Ca Successfully completed an R&D project that developed Electrical Transceivers for 10 Gigabit Ethernet switches and routers for optical and copper base networks  
•	Responsible for all prototypes builds and test processes of the CX4 XENPAK modules. 
•	Test and compile all characterization data to be reported to the project engineers. 
•	Improved process and reduce product cost for product introduction. 
•	Liaison between R&D, manufacturing and technical support for manufacturing. R&D Technician Gigabit Optics 2001  –  2002  (1 year) Sunnyvale Ca Worked on optical components to create sub-assemblies for use in optical networks for a variety of WDM applications including multi-port transmitters, receivers, and transceivers.  
•	Responsible for assembly and optical alignment of prototype Micro-MUX/DeMUX,  
•	Documenting test processes and engineering changes. 
•	Setup assembly station for Pilot production runs. Sr. Optoelectronics Technician New Focus 1997  –  2001  (4 years) San Jose Ca Collaborated on a research project to develop a tunable laser module for the optical network industry. Responsible for the integration and installation of prototype laser cavity into final package. Constructed and managed development labs and test stations. Evaluated all prototype modules at final test station. Complied final test data to be presented to develop engineering. Experience DLNA Certification Administrator/Technical Operations Digital Living Network Alliance (DLNA) November 2010  – Present (4 years 10 months) Portland, Oregon Area Responsible for being an expert on all aspects of the DLNA Certification Program and on DLNA Certified devices and their operation. 
 
Manage web development vendor and provide project management, defect tracking, and assist in design for updates to the web based certification system interface and database of certified products.	 
 
Provide technical demonstrations of DLNA devices at tradeshows (such as CES/IBC) and other meetings/events of the organization.  
 
Manage setup and coordination for global events including tradeshows and interoperability events and recruit new member companies.  
 
Manage wireless networking and product scheduling at DLNA Plugfests. 
 
Assist marketing with technical details of DLNA guidelines and implementations. Frimware Test Engineer (Contractor) Hewlett-Packard April 2009  –  October 2010  (1 year 7 months) Vancouver, Wa Writing and developing test cases and test scripts for printer firmware testing, managing tests and scripts, working with test teams to ensure accuracy of results, working with developers to implement test coverage for requirements, scheduling and maintenance of print quality and various other test environments. Technologies used for development include REST/LEDM, XML, and VB Scripting. SoftwareTest Engineer (Contractor) Intel Corporation February 2009  –  April 2009  (3 months) Hillsboro, Or Writing and developing test cases for third party and proprietary software solutions in an agile environment. Building SQL server networks from the ground, QA testing of the software and software environment. 
 
Manage, write, and track defects and implement test cases around new defects and issues during agile testing.  
 
Verifying fixes to third party applications as well as proprietary software. 
 
Working close with engineers to ensure the software schedule deadlines were met. Handset Test Technician (Contractor TEK Systems) AT&T September 2008  –  December 2008  (4 months) Austin, Texas Area Testing of various third party vendor GSM mobile devices (2G and 3G) against AT&T 10776 requirements on Anite test systems to ensure stability from occurring network changes. Experience in SIM programming, SAS software, automation testing, and manual interactive testing. Hardware/Software Test Engineer (Contractor) Intel Corporation June 2008  –  August 2008  (3 months) Hillsboro, Or Responsibilities included building PCs from ground up, develop test cases, identify bugs, debug issues, file bug reports, troubleshoot hardware issues, configure BIOS settings, BIOS manipulation, RAID configuration, test low-level system functionality, check OS drivers for HW components, execute test cases, and communicate results. QA Engineer – RAPIDGate® Secure Vetting System Eid Passport August 2007  –  May 2008  (10 months) Hillsboro, Or QA testing on proprietary software (3-tier business logic system) designed for the U.S. government (military and civilian) to ensure the product is ready for distribution in a production environment. 
 
Testing of new hardware, tools, and utilities were also part of my job responsibilities. 
 
Other duties included building stations for deployment to new locations and beta test units for existing vendors. 
 
Configuring all wireless and handheld devices to ensure, when deployed, they work properly in the field. 
 
SQL Server Installation, SQL queries, manipulating tables, running Jobs, verifying SQL table entries. Hardware/Software Verification Engineering Technician	(Contractor) Intel Corporation August 2006  –  July 2007  (1 year) Hillsboro, OR Reviewing of testing requirements, writing of test cases, unit and interoperability testing of network media devices, routers, various stress and wireless networking tests, firmware testing, building of test systems, BIOS upgrading and manipulation, and streaming media over various network configurations. 
 
In addition to testing, other responsibilities include writing and submitting defects, defect regression, defect tracking, inventory, writing documentation and instructions, learning new testing equipment/software tools, training technicians and various other tasks. Software & Firmware Test Technician (Contractor) Hewlett-Packard February 2006  –  August 2006  (7 months) Vancouver, Wa Defect triage of various printer platforms and products, building and testing of firmware builds using Linux, defect regression, script execution and editing, using a probe to pinpoint problems within firmware code, releasing firmware after it has been tested, Ad hoc testing, writing and editing defects in proprietary database, help in development of new processes, strong communication with lead engineers, and various other tasks. Hardware/Software Test Engineer Intel Corporation February 2005  –  February 2006  (1 year 1 month) Hillsboro, Or Reviewing testing requirements, writing test cases, unit and interoperability testing of Digital Media Adapters, Routers, and Sync N Go devices (MP3 Players, Personal Media Devices, PDA’s), writing test plans and procedures, various stress and wireless networking tests, building systems, BIOS upgrading, and streaming media over various network configurations. 
 
Other responsibilities include writing and submitting defects, defect regression, defect tracking, inventory, writing documentation and instructions, learning new testing equipment/software tools, training technicians and various other tasks. Hardware/Software Lead QA Test Technician/Trainer (Contractor) Hewlett-Packard June 2004  –  February 2005  (9 months) Vancouver, Wa Extensive hardware/software testing, including Bluetooth testing and 802.11, WHQL certification testing, all print functionality testing. Firmware testing, driver verification and testing, WHQL, debugging test scripts, digital imaging quality assessments, as well as training of technicians to learn firmware testing and troubleshooting as well as writing, regressing, and validating defects. Frequent participation in test process improvement. Summary Engineering Technician; Electrical Maintenance Technician; Lab Technician; Sincere, focused, tenacious, goal driven, creative problem solver. Background in safety compliance testing, medical device testing, telecom, troubleshooting & repair of analog and electrical systems. Passionate about audio and recording technology. Strengths include strong analytical and creative ability, excellent electronic and mechanical aptitude. Excels in team corroborations, independent project management and technical support roles.  
 
 
OVERVIEW 
•	8 years experience in the semiconductor industry; Intel, Toshiba, Fairchild 
•	5 years experience Senior Lab Technician with Underwriters Laboratories 
•	Technical experience in a variety of fields: telecom, electronic repair & calibration 
•	Experience with Tektronix high-speed storage scopes, power meters 
•	Over 15 years soldering experience including SMD & Mil-Spec wiring 
•	+15 years public speaking and teaching experience on a weekly basis 
•	Ability to develop instant rapport with customers and coworkers 
•	Skilled at restoring, rebuilding, modifying, and building and electronic devices  
•	Guitar amplifier design, fabrication, modifcation, & repairs 
•	Guitar effects building & repair 
•	Speaker enclosure design, fabrication, wiring, reconing 
•	AA Degree Graduate September 2011; GPA – 3.8 
 
 
Specialties: Technical: Mechanical & Electronic Assembly; Vacuum tube technology; schematic & layout drawing; audio devices; soldering & SMT rework; prototyping; hand held GPS devices; lighting tech ● Lab Testing: Medical devices; lighting; audio preamps and amplifiers; switching power supplies; neon power supplies High voltage testing; EMC testing ● Public Speaking & Teaching: Use of illustrations, charts, drawings & multimedia; directing public forum; staff technical training. Summary Engineering Technician; Electrical Maintenance Technician; Lab Technician; Sincere, focused, tenacious, goal driven, creative problem solver. Background in safety compliance testing, medical device testing, telecom, troubleshooting & repair of analog and electrical systems. Passionate about audio and recording technology. Strengths include strong analytical and creative ability, excellent electronic and mechanical aptitude. Excels in team corroborations, independent project management and technical support roles.  
 
 
OVERVIEW 
•	8 years experience in the semiconductor industry; Intel, Toshiba, Fairchild
